Job Title: Controls and Automation Engineer

Location: Ansonia, CT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Summary

A rapidly growing manufacturing company located in the greater New Haven, CT area is currently in search of a well-versed Controls Automation Engineer. The COntrols Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, programming, and maintaining all aspects of the industrial control systems. PLC & HMI Programming experience is a must. Excellent benefits

location: Ansonia, Connecticut

job type: Permanent

salary: $85,000 - 105,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 4pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

Responsible for designing, developing, programming, and maintaining all aspects of the industrial control systems Collects and reviews data for machine design requirements, electric motor and Variable Speed Drive power requirements, and wiring of electromagnetic and PLC based control panels, Motor Control Centers (MCC) etc. Confer with suppliers on design details, costs, and schedules of purchased products; evaluating supplier parts/systems. In designing machine controls, must program PLCs of known vendors such as Allen Bradley, Siemens and HMI/SCADA systems such as Wonderware, PanelView and other similar devices to properly operate, monitor, and make safe the operation of our machinery. From time to time make customer presentations in support of selling activities. From time to time work independently at the customer's facility to assist and advise during installation and start-up. The job requires domestic and international travel to customer sites worldwide. International experience in electrical/controls design requirements would be beneficial. Responsible for installation and operation of completed panels and system in compliance with specifications and safety standards. Test and troubleshoot machinery control systems.

Qualifications

Experience level: ExperiencedMinimum 2 years of experienceEducation: Bachelors

Skills

Electrical EngineeringAutomationAutomation AnywhereMachine DesignPLCHMI ProgrammingControlsControls

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

Applications accepted on ongoing basis until filled.

Experience Level (if available): None
